approved_story_facts: A plucked castle string in the Infinity Castle drives full-body sway in large hydrogen crowds and causes the disorientation.
An unmasked teenage Intruder (tanjiro-like original hero energy) wakes inside the castle and investigates why people are being pulled.
Core metaphor map is explicit in separate beats: water is divers behind glass, fat is sumo mass, bone is tai chi and buddhist groups at a support pillar, and the hidden source is Geisha (Lure).
MRI factual texture is explicit: T1 is longitudinal recovery time after excitation; water behaves longer-T1, fat behaves shorter-T1, and gadolinium shortens local T1 where it accumulates.
Athlete rotation is intentional metaphor: circular motion around a fixed pillar represents spin precession around one magnetic field axis before realignment.
Geisha (Lure) uses fan-timed rhythm to pull hydrogen people toward one central resource dais without explicit medical labeling before the end.
Intruder enters the circle to connect with high-energy hydrogen groups; a gadolinium-contrast wrist mark converts collapse into synchronized stability and reveals hidden resource flow.

Twist policy: before end credits there is no direct medical naming of tumor or glioblastoma; the explicit diagnosis appears only on the final end-card title text after the black-screen katana cut: "Глиобластома выявлена и удалена."
